Combine two dictionaries. If a key already exists in the first dictionary, the value from the second dictionary is ignored.

Parameters

  • dictionary_one â The first dictionary.

  • dictionary_two â The second dictionary.

Returns

A new combined dictionary.

static create_possible_combinations(items: Union[List[Any], Tuple[Any]], items_per_combination: int) → Set[Tuple[Any]]Â¶

Create a collection of all possible combinations of the specified items. Example: With items: [1, 2, 3] and combination_length: 2 the result will be: {(1, 2), (1, 3), (2, 3)}

Parameters

  • items â A collection of items to create combinations from.

  • items_per_combination â The number of items in each combination.

Returns

A collection of combinations

Flatten a collection of collections to a single list or itself if already flattened.

Parameters

to_flatten â The collection to flatten

Returns

A single flattened list or to_flatten if already flattened.

  • list_items â The items being searched for.

Returns

static get_component(component_container: objects.components.ComponentContainer, component_type: sims4communitylib.enums.types.component_types.CommonComponentType, add_dynamic: bool = False) → Optional[objects.components.Component]Â¶

Retrieve a component from a ComponentContainer.

  • component_type â The type of component being retrieved.

  • add_dynamic â Whether or not to add the component dynamically.

Returns

An empty function that does nothing. Useful when you need something to do nothing.

Create a function that will log the arguments and keyword arguments it receives

Parameters

  • func_identifier â An identifier for the function to determine which function was invoked

static run_predicate_with_reversed_result(predicate_function: Callable[[...], bool]) → Callable[[...], bool]Â¶

Wrap the specified predicate function and reverse the result of it when the function is invoked.

Parameters

predicate_function â The predicate function to reverse the result of.

Returns

A wrapped function.

static run_predicates_as_one(predicate_functions: Iterator[Callable[[...], bool]], all_must_pass: bool = True) → Callable[[...], bool]Â¶

Wrap all specified predicate functions into a single predicate function. (See returned value for more information).

Parameters

  • predicate_functions â The predicate functions to run as one.

  • all_must_pass â If True, all of the predicates must return a True value. If False, only some of the predicates must return a True value.

Returns

If all_must_pass is True a wrapped function that will return a value of: - True, if all predicates resulted in a True value. - False, if any predicates resulted in a False value.

If all_must_pass is False a wrapped function that will return a value of: - True, if any predicates resulted in a True value. - False, if all predicates resulted in a False value.

static run_with_arguments(primary_function: Callable[[...], Any], *args, **kwargs) → Callable[[...], Any]Â¶

Wrap a function and run it with additional arguments when something invokes it.

Parameters

primary_function â The function that will be run.

Returns

A wrapped function.

static safe_run(mod_identity: sims4communitylib.mod_support.mod_identity.CommonModIdentity, primary_function: Callable[[...], Any], fallback_function: Callable[[...], Any], *args, **kwargs) → AnyÂ¶

Safely run a function, if the primary function throws an exception, the fallback function will be run instead.

Parameters

  • mod_identity â The identity of the mod running a function safely.

  • primary_function â The primary function to safely run.

  • fallback_function â A function called when the primary function throws an exception.

  • args â Arguments to pass to both the primary function and fallback function.

  • kwargs â Keyword Arguments to pass to both the primary function and fallback function.

Returns

The result of either the primary function or the fallback function if the primary threw an exception.

CommonInjectionUtilsÂ¶

class CommonInjectionUtilsÂ¶

Bases: object

Utilities to inject custom functionality into other functions.

static inject_into(target_object: Any, target_function_name: str) → CallableÂ¶

deprecated:: 1.2.3 Use inject_safely_into() instead.

static inject_safely_into(mod_identity: sims4communitylib.mod_support.mod_identity.CommonModIdentity, target_object: Any, target_function_name: str) → CallableÂ¶

A decorator used to inject code into another function. It will catch and log exceptions and run the original function should any problems occur.

Example of cls usagecls usage

# cls usage
@CommonInjectionUtils.inject_safely_into(SimSpawner, SimSpawner.spawn_sim._name__)
def do_custom_spawn_sim(original, cls, *args, **kwargs):
    return original(*args, **kwargs)
Example of self usageself usage

# Self usage
@CommonInjectionUtils.inject_safely_into(SimInfo, SimInfo.load_sim_info.__name__)
def do_custom_load_sim_info(original, self, *args, **kwargs):
    return original(self, *args, **kwargs)

Note

Injection WILL work on

  • Functions decorated with âclassmethodâ

  • Functions with âclsâ or âselfâ as the first argument.

Note

Injection WILL NOT work on

  • Functions decorated with âstaticmethodâ

  • Global functions, i.e. Functions not contained within a class.

Parameters

  • mod_identity â The identity of the mod injecting into a function.

  • target_object (Any) â The class that contains the target function.

  • target_function_name (str) â The name of the function being injected to.

Returns

A wrapped function.

Return type

Callable

Bases: object

Utilities for handling reading/writing to and from files.

static load_from_file(file_path: str, buffering: int = 1, encoding: str = 'utf-8') → Optional[str]Â¶

Load string data from a file.

Parameters

  • file_path â The file to read from.

  • encoding â See the âopenâ function documentation for more details.

  • buffering â See the âopenâ function documentation for more details.

Returns

The contents of the file as a string or None if an error occurred.

static write_to_file(file_path: str, data: str, buffering: int = 1, encoding: str = 'utf-8', ignore_errors: bool = False) → boolÂ¶

Write string data to a file.

Parameters

  • file_path â The file to write to.

  • data â The data to write.

  • encoding â See the âopenâ function documentation for more details.

  • buffering â See the âopenâ function documentation for more details.

  • ignore_errors â If True, any exceptions thrown will be ignored (Useful in preventing infinite loops)

Returns

True if successful. False if not.
